sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core

Interface Resource<L extends Listener>

  • Type Parameters:
    L - the type of listeners compatible with this resource
    All Superinterfaces:
    Nameable, Registrable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DebugResource<L>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DebugResourceProxy

    public interface Resource<L extends Listener>
extends Nameable, Registrable
    A resource for managing registrable Listener instances. In general a resource implements listener registration mechanism as well as other supporting utilities for specific listener type. Resource may be also a source of listener events or act as a bridge between the event source and the listeners.

    Each resource is identified by its name returned by getName() method. Resource names should be fully qualified and unique for different resource implementations as resources with the same names are considered equal by the equals(Object) method.

    A resource must use Listener.equals(java.lang.Object) to determine whether two listeners should be considered as the same. Similarly a resource should always check if it supports the encountered listener type and appropriately throw a ClassCastException. Resource does not permit null listeners.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell
    See Also:
    Listener, Resources, DefaultResources

    • Method Detail

      • register

        void register(L listener)
        Registers a listener to this resource.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be registered, not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the type of the specified listener prevents it from being registered to this resource
        ListenerAlreadyRegistredException - if the specified listener is already registered and this resource panics
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener is null
        UnsupportedResourceException - if the resource does not support this operation (it could mean that it is not implemented yet)

      • unregister

        void unregister(L listener)
        Unregisters a listener from this resource.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be unregistered, not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the type of the specified listener prevents it from being unregistered from this resource
        ListenerNotRegistredException - if the specified listener is not registered and this resource panics
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener is null
        UnsupportedResourceException - if the resource does not support this operation (it could mean that it is not implemented yet)

      • unregisterAll

        void unregisterAll(java.lang.Class<? extends Listener> type)
        Unregisters all listeners assignable to the specified listener type. A listener is assignable to a listener type if it is an instance of that type.
        Parameters:
        type - the listener type to which the assignable listeners are going be unregistered, not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener type is null
        UnsupportedResourceException - if the resource does not support this operation (it could mean that it is not implemented yet)

      • registered

        <U extends Listener> java.util.Collection<U> registered(java.lang.Class<U> type)
        Returns all registered listeners assignable to the specified listener type. A listener is assignable to a listener type if it is an instance of that type.
        Parameters:
        type - the listener type of the registered listeners, not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener type is null

      • registered

        boolean registered(Listener listener)
        Determines whether the specified listener is registered to this resource.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be checked, not null
        Returns:
        true if the specified listener is registered to this resource, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener is null

      • equals

        boolean equals(@Nullable
             java.lang.Object o)
        Compares the specified object with this resource for equality. Returns true if the specified object is also resource and the two resources have the same name. This definition ensures that this method works properly across different implementations of the resource interface.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - an object to be compared for equality with this resource
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is equal to this resource, false otherwise
